definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
see 黑沉沉[hei1 chen1 chen1]
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
(negative prefix)/not/no
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: So can all sink not to live to exasperate for several annuals, those small youth men, .
sentences.chinese: 這麼多年，那些小後生們，可都沉不住氣了。

sentences.english: I said that a little too loudly, didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 大驚小怪的啊，一點也沉不住氣。

sentences.english: The more letters Shen wrote, the less patience he had.
sentences.chinese: 信越寫越多，沈從文也越發的沉不住氣。

sentences.english: Don't get excited the moment you hear a criticism.
sentences.chinese: 不要一聽到批評就沉不住氣。

definition: traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
crybaby
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
crafty/slippery/slyboots
to withdraw/to hole up
lit. bum beetle/sb who tags along/shadow/sycophant
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
annoying/disgusting
confused/vague/indistinct/muddle-headed/mixed up/in a daze
cowering/cringing
